attributes.action: Restore Early-May Study Leave for GCSE Students Across the UK
attributes.additional_details: Moving study leave to early June disadvantages GCSE students, as most exams will already be completed by then. Previously, students had 2–3 weeks of study leave to revise independently and only attended school for exams. Requiring attendance throughout the exam period reduces revision time and creates unfairness compared to previous years.
attributes.background: We ask the Government to reinstate early-May study leave for GCSE students. Removing early study leave limits revision time, increases stress, and may negatively affect exam performance and overall GCSE results across the UK.

rejection.details: Decisions about study leave are for individual schools and colleges, not the UK Government or Parliament. You may wish to contact your school or college directly about this issue.
